diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute cholecystitis, aspiration pneumonia, MRSA bacteremia
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with fever, tachypnea, abdominal distension, and a suspected aspiration event. Chest radiograph showed new hazy opacity in the right lung base suggestive of aspiration, worsening retrocardiac opacity consistent with consolidation or atelectasis, along with bilateral small pleural effusions, supporting the diagnoses of aspiration pneumonia and acute cholecystitis.
